title: 3,100-Mile British Racing Green 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring 6-Speed
description: This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring was specified in paint-to-sample British Racing Green over a black leather and cloth interior with carbon-fiber trim accents, and its options include Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, a front-axle lift system, dynamic LED headlights, Bose surround-sound, and adaptive sport seats plus with leather backs. Power is from a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car has been fitted with a titanium full exhaust system and a radar-detection system. This 991.2 GT3 Touring has 3k miles, was purchased new by its current owner through Porsche of Plano, Texas, and is now offered on dealer consignment in Arizona with a window sticker, the owner's manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 3,100-Mile British Racing Green 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring 6-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #202,517.
text: This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring was specified in paint-to-sample British Racing Green over a black leather and cloth interior with carbon-fiber trim accents, and its options include Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, a front-axle lift system, dynamic LED headlights, Bose surround-sound, and adaptive sport seats plus with leather backs. Power is from a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car has been fitted with a titanium full exhaust system and a radar-detection system. This 991.2 GT3 Touring has 3k miles, was purchased new by its current owner through Porsche of Plano, Texas, and is now offered on dealer consignment in Arizona with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title. The GT3 Touring includes a revised decklid with a mesh grille as well as a retractable rear spoiler in place of the raised wing found on the standard GT3. This example is finished in British Racing Green, a $12,830 non-metallic, custom-color selection, and additional equipment includes LED headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System (PDLS). Clear paint-protection film has been applied up front. The 20″ center-lock alloy wheels are mounted with 2018-dated Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Braking is handled by yellow Porsche-branded calipers over ceramic-composite rotors. The black leather interior features heated adaptive sport seats with cloth centers and leather backs as well as carbon-fiber trim accents and the Light Design Package. Options include illuminated carbon-fiber sill plates, self-dimming mirrors, and a Bose surround-sound system. A radar-detection system has been installed. The three-spoke steering wheel frames a central GT3-branded tachometer as well as a 225-mph speedometer, an LCD screen, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 3,100 miles. The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque, and the car was optioned with an extended-range fuel tank. A titanium exhaust system has been installed, and the removed components are included in the sale. An annual service was completed in preparation for the sale. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below. The window sticker lists initial delivery to Porsche of Plano, Texas, along with factory colors, equipment, and a total retail price of $187,700 The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage. The Texas title lists “Actual Mileage” in the Remark(s) section. Photo Gallery You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2018 Porsche 911 GT3 Touring was specified in paint-to-sample British Racing Green over a black leather and cloth interior with carbon-fiber trim accents, and its options include Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes, a front-axle lift system, dynamic LED headlights, Bose surround-sound, and adaptive sport seats plus with leather backs. Power is from a 4.0-liter flat-six paired with a six-speed manual transaxle, and the car has been fitted with a titanium full exhaust system and a radar-detection system. This 991.2 GT3 Touring has 3k miles, was purchased new by its current owner through Porsche of Plano, Texas, and is now offered on dealer consignment in Arizona with a window sticker, the owner’s manual, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Texas title.

The GT3 Touring includes a revised decklid with a mesh grille as well as a retractable rear spoiler in place of the raised wing found on the standard GT3. This example is finished in British Racing Green, a $12,830 non-metallic, custom-color selection, and additional equipment includes LED headlights with Porsche Dynamic Lighting System (PDLS). Clear paint-protection film has been applied up front.

The 20″ center-lock alloy wheels are mounted with 2018-dated Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires. Braking is handled by yellow Porsche-branded calipers over ceramic-composite rotors.

The black leather interior features heated adaptive sport seats with cloth centers and leather backs as well as carbon-fiber trim accents and the Light Design Package. Options include illuminated carbon-fiber sill plates, self-dimming mirrors, and a Bose surround-sound system. A radar-detection system has been installed.

The three-spoke steering wheel frames a central GT3-branded tachometer as well as a 225-mph speedometer, an LCD screen, and gauges for oil pressure, oil temperature, coolant temperature, and fuel level. The optional Sport Chrono Package added a stopwatch atop the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 3,100 miles.

The 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 500 horsepower and 339 lb-ft of torque, and the car was optioned with an extended-range fuel tank. A titanium exhaust system has been installed, and the removed components are included in the sale. An annual service was completed in preparation for the sale.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with Porsche Torque Vectoring. Additional photographs of the underside are shown in the gallery below.

The window sticker lists initial delivery to Porsche of Plano, Texas, along with factory colors, equipment, and a total retail price of $187,700

The Carfax report shows no accidents or damage.

The Texas title lists “Actual Mileage” in the Remark(s) section.
